2050. Can the ancient tree help
people?  Questions about adapting
to climate change as well as predicting the
future of the earth's climate,
the answer can be found in
Chile's Vanan rainforest where there is a
cypress tree that is nearly 5,000 years
old.  The giant patagonia, up to
45 meters tall, is uniquely protected in a
humid rainforest within its trunk.
Scientists can find
invaluable records of how life adapts to
climate change on the planet.
Researchers used a T-shaped drill
to drill and core samples out of the
tree. Combined with information about tree rings
and comparisons from other sources,
the tree is estimated to have an 80-year chance of
being  More than 5,000 years
old, ancient species such as the Patagonia cypress tree
have a very special genome when
compared to the genome of other tree species. They
have the ability to resist weather changes and
adapt wonderfully to the new environment.
This is the
best athlete of the natural world. The
miraculous survival of trees is explained
by the hypothesis of the ability to handle
stress when soil erosion or root rot
occurs. The entire tree does not die but only  There are
parts that are under direct pressure. They
have a shell mechanism that allows the
living tissues underneath to receive water from
healthy roots. There are still

While climbing a boat with

attacked the man. The man was not injured,
but the woman was seriously injured and
died at the scene. Bahamas officials did
not release the victim's identity.
This is a 44-year-old tourist from
Boston, USA. It is currently unknown what species of shark
